00001 #include <stdio.h>
00002 #include "headers/BRO_spam_fists.h"
00003 #include "headers/BRO_spam_client.h"
00004 #include "headers/BRO_spam_pid.h"
00005 
00006 
00007 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00008 /* OSEK declarations                                                        */
00009 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00010 DeclareCounter(SysTimerCnt);
00011 DeclareResource(lcd);
00012 DeclareTask(BRO_Comm);
00013 DeclareTask(PID_Controller);
00014 DeclareTask(Speed_Updater);
00015 DeclareTask(DisplayTask);
00016 
00017 engines_t engines = {
00018     {.port = NXT_PORT_A, .speed_control_type = NOT_USING, .speed_ref = 0},
00019     {.port = NXT_PORT_B, .speed_control_type = NOT_USING, .speed_ref = 0},
00020     {.port = NXT_PORT_C, .speed_control_type = NOT_USING, .speed_ref = 0}
00021 };
00022 
00023 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00024 /* LEJOS OSEK hooks                                                         */
00025 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00026 void ecrobot_device_initialize()
00027 {
00028     ecrobot_init_bt_slave("1234");
00029     ecrobot_init_sonar_sensor(SONAR_PORT);
00030     ecrobot_set_light_sensor_active(LIGHT_PORT);
00031 }
00032 
00033 
00034 void ecrobot_device_terminate()
00035 {
00036     nxt_motor_set_speed(NXT_PORT_A, 0, 1);
00037     nxt_motor_set_speed(NXT_PORT_B, 0, 1);
00038     nxt_motor_set_speed(NXT_PORT_C, 0, 1);
00039         
00040     ecrobot_set_light_sensor_inactive(LIGHT_PORT);
00041     ecrobot_term_sonar_sensor(SONAR_PORT);
00042 
00043     ecrobot_term_bt_connection();
00044 }
00045 
00046 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00047 /* Function to be invoked from a category 2 interrupt                       */
00048 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00049 void user_1ms_isr_type2(void)
00050 {
00051     StatusType ercd;
00052 
00053     /*
00054      *  Increment OSEK Alarm System Timer Count
00055     */
00056     ercd = SignalCounter( SysTimerCnt );
00057     if ( ercd != E_OK ) {
00058         ShutdownOS( ercd );
00059     }
00060 }
00061 
00062 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00063 /* Task information:                                                        */
00064 /* -----------------                                                        */
00065 /* Name    : PID_Controller                                                 */
00066 /* Priority: 3                                                              */
00067 /* Typ     : EXTENDED TASK                                                  */
00068 /* Schedule: preemptive                                                     */
00069 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00070 TASK(PID_Controller)
00071 {
00072     
00073     /*  We will now update the powers for each motor.
00074      *  If a motor is set as RAW_POWER then the first "powers" value is used
00075      *  directly for the speed update, while if a motor is set as PID_CONTROLLED
00076      *  the speed_ref is used in combination with the PID Controller, which
00077      *  computes the power needed to reach the target DegPS (Degrees Per Second)
00078      *  Oblviously it will be possible for the users to not install a motor,
00079      *  so we won't do anything with the ports on which there is nothing.
00080      */
00081     
00082     if (engines.first.speed_control_type != NOT_USING) {
00083         //  Updating speed errors
00084         update_errors(&engines.first);
00085         
00086         //  If we are controlling  it with PID we have to compute the power...
00087         if (engines.first.speed_control_type == PID_CONTROLLED) {
00088             update_powers(&engines.first);
00089         }
00090         //  Alternatively we will use the power set by the BT Task.
00091         
00092         //  Now we will set the powers using the data inside the motor's
00093         //  structure.
00094         nxt_motor_set_speed(engines.first.port, engines.first.powers[0], 1);
00095     };
00096     
00097     //  Doing the same thing for the second motor
00098     
00099     if (engines.second.speed_control_type != NOT_USING) {
00100         update_errors(&engines.second);
00101         if (engines.second.speed_control_type == PID_CONTROLLED) {
00102             update_powers(&engines.second);
00103         }
00104         nxt_motor_set_speed(engines.second.port, engines.second.powers[0], 1);
00105     };
00106     
00107     //  And, guess what? We are doing it even for the third motor.
00108     
00109     if (engines.third.speed_control_type != NOT_USING) {
00110         update_errors(&engines.third);
00111         if (engines.third.speed_control_type == PID_CONTROLLED) {
00112             update_powers(&engines.third);
00113         }
00114         nxt_motor_set_speed(engines.third.port, engines.third.powers[0], 1);
00115     };    
00116 
00117     TerminateTask();
00118 }
00119 
00120 TASK(Speed_Updater)
00121 {
00122     //  Updating Speeds (And by that I mean the average DegPS for the motors)
00123     if (engines.first.speed_control_type != NOT_USING) {
00124         update_speed(&engines.first);
00125     }
00126     
00127     if (engines.second.speed_control_type != NOT_USING) {
00128         update_speed(&engines.second);
00129     }
00130     
00131     if (engines.third.speed_control_type != NOT_USING) {
00132         update_speed(&engines.third);
00133     }
00134     
00135     TerminateTask();
00136 }
00137 
00138 TASK(BRO_Comm)
00139 {
00140     U32 connect_status = 0;
00141     
00142     /*  Declaring two buffers for communication */
00143     bro_fist_t in_packet[BUFFER_SIZE];
00144     bro_fist_t out_packet[BUFFER_SIZE];
00145     
00146     memset (in_packet, 0, sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE);
00147     memset (out_packet, 0, sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE);
00148 
00149     /*  As you might know we have a problem here... :3
00150      *  That problem is that the BT device installed on the AT91SAM7 seems to
00151      *  have some speed problems with the receiving for the first data via BT.
00152      *  It needs ~40ms to get every kind of data (Even a uint32) so we will have
00153      *  to use some kind of pooling (not really pooling, because it would lock
00154      *  the NXT, mind you ;) ) and work on the data received only when some
00155      *  data, usually all of it (I won't tell you to read the device drivers
00156      *  for BlueTooth written for nxtOSEK, but the ecrobot_read_bt_packet checks
00157      *  if all the data declared in the first byte is present in the device's
00158      *  buffer.
00159      *
00160      *  No problem, with our drill we will pierce the Heavens!
00161      *  (And also with our BROFists, right?)
00162      */
00163     connect_status = ecrobot_read_bt_packet(in_packet, sizeof(bro_fist_t)*BUFFER_SIZE);
00164     
00165     // Se sono arrivati dei dati...
00166     if (connect_status > 0) {
00167         // Decodifica ed elabora i pacchetti ricevuti
00168         decode_bro_fists (in_packet, out_packet, &engines);
00169         // Invia la risposta
00170         bt_send((U8*)out_packet, sizeof(bro_fist_t)*BUFFER_SIZE);
00171     }
00172 
00173     TerminateTask();
00174 }
00175 
00176 TASK(DisplayTask)
00177 {
00178     ecrobot_status_monitor("BROFist Client");
00179     TerminateTask();
00180 }
